text: The Chinese Elm cultivar Ulmus parvifolia 'Red Fall' is an American clone selected by S. Bieberich of the Sunshine Nursery, Clinton, Oklahoma. ==Description== As the name implies, the tree is distinguished by the intense red colouration of its foliage in autumn. Dirr, M. A., Nursery Manager, 9(6): 30-33, 1993. ==Pests and diseases== The species and its cultivars are highly resistant, but not immune, to Dutch elm disease, and unaffected by the Elm Leaf Beetle Xanthogaleruca luteola. ==Cultivation== 'Red Fall' is not known to be in cultivation beyond North America. ==Synonymy== *Ulmus 'Red': Anon. ==Accessions== None known. ==References== Category:Chinese elm cultivar Category:Ulmus articles missing images Category:Ulmus
title: Ulmus parvifolia 'Red Fall'
